Images: 
  • Read more about Intranet Portal Design
  •   0

Description

Problem Statement
Customer had very basic and outdated  intranet portal which very few people in organization were making regular us of it. There was no central location for users to manage or share content. There was a need to upgrade and improve the document management system and processes in order to improve team collaboration. As for the intranet’s users, the goals were for it to provide easy access to documentation and content repositories, help get work done faster, and inspire and motivate staff.

 

Solution
Client and Proventeq , together decided to make use of SharePoint as their next portal due to more user friendly alternative to its existing intranet solution. 
We developed various custom web parts for Intranet Portal including custom article page layout, feed web parts for displaying weather, feeds from twitter etc. We also created custom article page layout, which was getting rendered on home page, sequentially. There were few sub-sites for each department like HR, Sales, and Marketing with all possible customization based on each department’s requirements.  For portal adoption among users, we conducted series of sessions with each user group to understand how they are collaborating through portal.
We also developed Nintex workflow for stabilizing few business processes which needs to review and approve/reject by higher authority before publishing on portal.
To increase collaboration, portal also contained channels such as forums, blogs.

 

Benefits

  • Greater adoption, automation of key processes
  • Improved collaboration among dispersed employees
  • Increased productivity and collaboration
  • Robust, quick and easy communication platform for collaboration 

 

  • Date Published: 07/10/2015
  • Categories:
  • Skills: SharePoint 2010, JavaScript, HTML, Nintex, Yammer

Images: 
  • Read more about Common Site Template on SP 2010
  •   0

Description

Problem Statement
As a global firm, communication and collaboration among its multiple business units was a difficult task. There were no guidelines on where to search data of all other projects happening in company and where to store data. Also there was inadequate governance on the sites to which they had access which resulted in the inability for users to quickly and easily find and share relevant data. Every team site looked and operated differently creating inefficiencies and information chaos. Data was everywhere, often repeated in multiple locations. To address this challenge, the client wanted common navigation, both global and local, and site templates for all business units, management teams and other teams within the company. 

Solution
Proventeq created a Portal to standardize the look and feel across team sites. This included using common site templates for business units, management, and team sites for information sharing and collaboration. This activity also provided an opportunity to clean up and tag old data for easy search and sharing. Document management capabilities were utilized.
We created common site templates with business-specific metadata elements. Portal helped team to implement global navigation, local navigation, and metadata and site templates. All these templates then deployed on production environment and used for any future site creation. We also implemented SP social features which helped user to communicate with each other in more efficient way.


Benefits

  • Efficient platform to store and search contents
  • Quick search due to tagging of metadata with contents 
  • Increased productivity and collaboration
  • Consistent layout throughout the portal makes it easy for user to understand it
  • Date Published: 07/10/2015
  • Categories:
  • Skills: SharePoint 2013, JavaScript, HTML
